The new-look Detroit Red Pistons still have the Los Angeles Lakers' number. Rasheed Wallace had 25 points and 13 rebounds, Allen Iverson added 25 points and the Pistons handed the Lakers their first loss of the season, 106-95 Friday night. The win was the Pistons' eighth in the last 10 meetings. Kobe Bryant scored 29 points for the Lakers, but went 12-of-30 from the floor. "We just played a good all-around game, Allen Iverson said after the Pistons won for the third time since his arrival from Denver five games ago.
